column4: ok, I'm having trouble with linux-restricted-modules that I didn't really expect
I install linux-k7 and linux-restricted-modules
upon restart, I get Xorg startup errors of:  Symbol __glXgetActiveScreen from module /usr/X11R6/lib/modules/extensions/libdri.a is unresolved!
Symbol __glXgetActiveScreen from module /usr/X11R6/lib/modules/extensions/libdri.a is unresolved!
are you using DRI?
no
what graphics card?
GF4 MX440
are you using the proprietary nvidia drivers?
yes, that's why I need linux-restricted-modules
XFCE, or fluxbox then? :)
no, i run http://wmi.modprobe.de
my window manager is called 'wmii'
on my work machine and student machines i run KDE
heh, I haven't heard of it, I'll have to look at it once I get X running again
worth a look.. great to use.
try 'sudo modprobe nvidia'
i would say your /etc/X11/xorg.conf still has references for the old driver 'nv'
I've just manually installed the nvidia driver from the bin, seems to work..also for some reason it decided to give my secondary ATi a PCI device ID which was wrong :/
ok.. can happen
any idea of problems with the latest nvidia driver..for some reason X occasionally completely freezes other than mouse with it..I might have to go back to 6111 if it does it again
hmm, is wmii by any chance like ratpoison?
